issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I've started to notice that the login form for the user console is taking a really long time to load.  The initial page loads but the form does not show for often over 10 seconds.  It happens on first page visit and anytime you logout or refresh the login page. Checking messages log there is a lot of loading of javascript and other pages. I'm not sure why we need to load all these for the log in page.

I tried to grab an example. Here you can see it takes about 30 seconds for everything to be fetched
{code}
Jul 18 08:25:48 b-13 304 GET /lib/visualsearch-datauri.css (10.8.0.114) 0.99ms

fields.summary: User Console login page slow to render

comments.body:
Most of those are simply not loaded again (304: not modified). But, they are requests to the server.
We have plans in 3.4 to try reducing what gets loaded up front and do more on-demand loading as the app runs.
Tony, can you get us a system where this is trapped?

One thing we can do to help is lazy load help files. That can be implemented completely independently of a larger "requires.js" re-org. If we can simply include help URLs in landing pages, and rivets templates (for wizards and dialogs), those can load the content on demand, doing away with help.js

This issue was previously scheduled to be worked on in more than one sprint:
* '3.4 Sprint 1' (on board '3.3 Release Board')
* '3.3 Sprint 4' (on board 'Test 3.3 Board')
* '3.3 Sprint 4' (on board 'Copy of 3.3 Release Board')

Starting from JIRA Agile 6.3, an issue can only belong to a single future sprint. Read more about this change: http://docs.atlassian.com/agile/docs-0630/Sprint+Marker+Migration

This issue is now scheduled for future sprint '3.4 Sprint 1' (on board '3.3 Release Board').

If this is incorrect, please update the issue accordingly.

This comment was automatically generated by JIRA. If it is no longer relevant, please feel free to delete it.

This was addressed in a PR from Sang-Min, which was also patched on 3.3.x In effect, the help file loading is mostly deferred till after the login screen loads. Only 2 are loaded prior which speeds up how quickly the user sees the first login page.
Seems to be fairly snappy every time now for me.
